meanings.definition: To carry or convey something to a place
meanings.sent1: I will bring the book to school tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: Can you bring the groceries from the car?
meanings.sent3: He forgot to bring his lunch, so he had to buy food at school.
meanings.sent4: Her smile always brings warmth to the room.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh cookies can bring joy to anyone.

meanings.definition: To cause someone or something to come to a place
meanings.sent1: The teacher's whistle will bring the students back inside.
meanings.sent2: The sound of the bell brings the birds to the feeder.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to bring a rabbit out of a hat.
meanings.sent4: His speech brought tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The music can bring memories flooding back.

meanings.definition: To make something happen or exist
meanings.sent1: Studying hard will bring success in the exam.
meanings.sent2: Positive thoughts can bring good things into your life.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient can bring out amazing flavors.
meanings.sent4: Her determination brought about positive changes in the community.
meanings.sent5: A single spark can bring a whole new idea to life.
